description: {"blocks":[{"key":"11oaf","text":"This procedure provides instructions for how to perform qualitative PCR (qPCR) for the detection of the IS481 insertion sequence of Bordetella pertussis and the pIS1001 insertion sequence of the Bordetella parapertussis from appropriate direct specimens. The IS481 insertion has been found to be present in some strains of B. bronchiseptica and most strains of B. holmesii. Some strains of B. bronchseptica also carry the pIS1001insertion sequence. The B. holmesii and B. bronchiseptica multiplex qPCR should be performed when indicated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":132,"length":20},{"style":"italic","offset":195,"length":24},{"style":"italic","offset":323,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":361,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":390,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":453,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":468,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"7h90s","text":"Perform all manipulations of samples and DNA in a genomic level PCR laboratory. Prepare PCR master mixes in a Reagent Preparation Clean Room. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

New Microbes and New Infections, 70-74.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q936","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fplc","text":"2. Tatti, K. M., Sparks, K. N., Boney, K. O., \u0026 Tondella, M. L. (2011). Novel Multitarget Real-Time PCR Assay for Rapid Detection of Bordetella Species in Clinical Specimens. Journal of Clinical Microbiology, 4059-4066.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ek3nq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3grae","text":"    ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure D: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bt3bf","text":"Under \"Options\" (at the bottom of the screen) Select \"IS481\"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure D: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"64g36","text":"Unclick Auto threshold and enter a manual value of 0.1. Click \"Auto Baseline\". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure D: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3habg","text":"Repeat steps 34 \u0026 35 for targets \"pIS1001\", \"HBG\", and \"IPC\" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure D: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7tm5r","text":"Click on the \"Analyze\" button. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure D: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ahn4h","text":"Ensure that under \"Plot Settings\" the \"Delta Rn vs. Cycle\" option is selected and plot colour is set to \"target\".  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Procedure D: 7500 FAST Run Analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1q5p7","text":"View the results of all run controls and ensure they have produced acceptable values before proceeding with clinical sample analysis.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"707or","text":"Method Limitations: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d675a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4083","text":"1. The IS481 insertion element has been found to be present in some strains of B. bronchiseptica and most, if not all strains of B. holmesii.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":78,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":129,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2aba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"du3ir","text":"2. Procedure for indications of when to run the PCR specific to B. holmesii.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":64,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8sghv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5f22b","text":"3. The pIS1001 insertion sequence has been found in some strains of B. bronchiseptica. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":68,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62pfq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"p9q3","text":"4. The IPC uses the same primers as the IS481 amplicon, so a negative IPC signal when IS481 is positive is not indicative of inhibition.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"flodt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
